channel.title: Whats the piece of code that makes GFX wait
channel.description:
i know that actiotimer = 10 ext
dosent work for anything...
but... i need to know
how do u make GFX wait?

item.source: Whats the piece of code that makes GFX wait

item.title: Whats the piece of code that makes GFX wait
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

Alright, somewhere under

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

in your client.java add

public int mironictimer = 2;

Then under that where ever… add something like this

public void Mironic(int i1) { if (mironictimer == 2) { stillgfx(gfx#, absY, absX); mironictimer -= 1; } if (mironictimer == 0) { stillgfx(gfx#, absY, absX); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Whats the piece of code that makes GFX wait
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:5, topic:232982”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=307255.msg2456973#msg2456973 date=1222292028]
if this isn’t your question, I would like to know (i don’t feel like making another thread if it’s the same question)

How do you make an emote happen only once. emotes tend to loop, how to you add a timer or something to it so that it plays only once.
[/quote]

only happen once. Is startAnimation(####);

ahhh but you want timers… Hold on a second and I’ll make you a little timer tutorial[/quote]thanks

Read full topic
